description: Sudan's war has displaced more than 10 million people and half the country faces starvations. The country's medical services have collapsed leaving a patchwork of charities, local groups and the Sudanese diaspora to try to provide what health care they can. NPR's Africa correspondent takes us to one of the few remaining hospitals, near the Sudanese capital.
title: What a Hospital in War-torn Sudan Looks Like

description: The new doll is being scrutinized for the color of her skin, her facial features and her garb. Early reviews are Barbie-tastic.
title: Hello Diwali Barbie! What is India saying about your skin tone and your vibe?

description: Your unusual chance to see a comet in the sky is here. C/2023 A3 Tsuchinshan-ATLAS was discovered by astronomers in 2023 — and will appear to the naked eye over the next couple weeks.
title: Rare comet to streak across night sky. Here’s how you can see it

description: A federal program kills hundreds of thousands of wild animals a year. Documents obtained by NPR show that many of those animals were killed in places where no damage to livestock was reported.
title: 'That’s a bloodbath': How a federal program kills wildlife for private interests

description: Keret, who lives in Tel Aviv, reflects on the protests in Israel and the U.S. over the hostages and Gaza. The son of Holocaust survivors, he has left- and right-wing political views in his own family.
title: Internationally acclaimed Israeli writer Etgar Keret looks back on a year of war

description: Driverless cars are expanding into more markets across the country. In San Francisco they’re already ubiquitous, but the robo-taxis' behaviors are unsettling riders.
title: Why does it feel so weird to ride in a driverless car?

description: Ethel Kennedy, the widow of Sen. Robert F. Kennedy who raised their 11 children after he was assassinated and remained dedicated to social causes for decades thereafter, died Thursday.
title: Ethel Kennedy, social activist and widow of Robert F. Kennedy, dies at age 96

description: The 38-year-old tennis legend, who has been dealing with injuries in recent years, said he will step away from the sport after next month’s Davis Cup finals.
title: Rafael Nadal announces his retirement from tennis after 22 Grand Slam titles

description: A team from NPR speaks with voters along a 15-mile road that cuts through the Milwaukee area's segregated neighborhoods as election season continues in this crucial swing state.
title: What matters to key swing state voters in Wisconsin? A single road offers a glimpse

description: This election, the future of health coverage for fertility treatments has been a hot political issue. A new report highlights what coverage looks like for American workers right now.
title: Politicians say health plans should cover IVF. Currently only 1 in 4 employers do

description: Hurricane Milton made landfall last night as a Category 3 storm with 120 mph winds. Today, we track its aftermath through Florida. And, why the GOP is gaining more Black male voters.
title: Tracking Hurricane Milton's destruction. And, why more Black men are backing the GOP

description: Washington Post editors lost faith in former tech columnist Taylor Lorenz, who called President Biden a "war criminal" and initially misled them about it. She has launched a new digital magazine.
title: Taylor Lorenz leaves 'Washington Post' after rift with editors

description: The attack on residents of Pont-Sondé on Oct. 3 was one of the biggest massacres that Haiti has seen in recent history. The U.N. had previously said that at least 70 people were killed.
title: The death toll in a gang attack on a Haitian town rises to at least 115
